description: Comprehensive scenario pack for all healthcare operations

scenarios.SA: Nurse notices vital sign trend but doesn't connect to early sepsis indicators.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to call rapid response vs. continue monitoring borderline patient.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating patient status change to physician using SBAR format.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating patient care during shift change with multiple acuity levels.
scenarios.LEAD: Charge nurse managing unit staffing when census unexpectedly increases.
scenarios.HF: Medication administration accuracy during high-interruption environment.

scenarios.SA: Triage nurse assesses current patient but doesn't anticipate waiting room deterioration.
scenarios.DM: Deciding triage level for patient with atypical presentation.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating critical information during trauma team activation.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating multiple trauma activations with limited resources.
scenarios.LEAD: Charge nurse managing department during mass casualty incident.
scenarios.HF: Decision quality after 10 hours of high-acuity patient care.

scenarios.SA: Physician reviews current labs but doesn't connect to medication interaction risk.
scenarios.DM: Deciding treatment approach when evidence supports multiple options.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating diagnosis and prognosis to patient and family clearly.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating care plan with multiple consulting specialists.
scenarios.LEAD: Attending managing resident education while maintaining patient safety.
scenarios.HF: Diagnostic accuracy during overnight call after multiple admissions.

scenarios.SA: Anesthesiologist monitors vitals but doesn't project airway complication risk.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to proceed with surgery when patient presents new symptom.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating count discrepancy during surgical closing.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating room turnover between cases with limited staff.
scenarios.LEAD: Surgeon managing team dynamics when conflict arises during procedure.
scenarios.HF: Attention to detail during long complex surgical case.

scenarios.SA: Pharmacist reviews order but doesn't connect to patient's other medications.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to approve therapeutic substitution during shortage.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating drug interaction concern to prescribing physician.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating medication preparation during code blue.
scenarios.LEAD: Pharmacy manager prioritizing during multiple stat medication requests.
scenarios.HF: Verification accuracy during high-volume dispensing periods.

scenarios.SA: Tech notices sample quality issue but doesn't connect to potential collection problem.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to report critical value via exception or standard protocol.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating critical lab result to appropriate provider immediately.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating STAT specimen processing during ED surge.
scenarios.LEAD: Lab manager addressing specimen labeling error pattern.
scenarios.HF: Analysis accuracy during overnight shift with limited staffing.

scenarios.SA: Tech positions patient but doesn't anticipate contrast reaction risk factors.
scenarios.DM: Deciding imaging protocol when order doesn't match clinical presentation.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating urgent finding to ordering provider for immediate action.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating portable imaging with nursing care activities.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing equipment failure during high-volume period.
scenarios.HF: Image quality consistency during back-to-back examinations.

scenarios.SA: RT notices ventilator parameter but doesn't project weaning readiness.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to call for intubation vs. continue BiPAP trial.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating patient respiratory status change to care team.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating care during rapid response or code blue.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing RT coverage across multiple critical patients.
scenarios.HF: Assessment accuracy when managing multiple ventilator patients.

scenarios.SA: Transporter moving patient doesn't notice oxygen tank level.
scenarios.DM: Deciding transport route when elevator is out of service for critical patient.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating patient handoff information to receiving department.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating multiple transport requests during discharge surge.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor prioritizing competing urgent transport requests.
scenarios.HF: Attention to safety details during high-volume transport periods.

scenarios.SA: EVS tech cleaning room doesn't notice isolation signage change.
scenarios.DM: Deciding cleaning protocol when isolation status is unclear.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating room readiness status to nursing and admissions.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating terminal clean with nursing for urgent admission.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team during outbreak requiring enhanced cleaning.
scenarios.HF: Cleaning protocol compliance during extended shift.

scenarios.SA: Registrar enters information but doesn't notice discrepancy with previous records.
scenarios.DM: Deciding how to handle patient without identification in emergency situation.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating financial options to patient sensitively and clearly.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating registration during mass casualty influx.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing queue during ED surge with limited staff.
scenarios.HF: Data entry accuracy during high-volume registration periods.

scenarios.SA: Case manager focuses on current discharge but doesn't anticipate readmission risk factors.
scenarios.DM: Deciding discharge disposition when patient and family disagree on plan.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating complex discharge needs across multiple providers and family.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating care conference with physician, nursing, family, and receiving facility.
scenarios.LEAD: Manager addressing discharge delays affecting hospital throughput.
scenarios.HF: Decision quality when managing excessive caseload.

scenarios.SA: Tech services equipment but doesn't connect wear pattern to pending failure.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to repair critical equipment vs. take offline for safety.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating equipment safety concern to clinical staff.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating equipment maintenance with clinical operations.
scenarios.LEAD: Manager prioritizing repairs during multiple critical equipment failures.
scenarios.HF: Technical accuracy during emergency equipment repairs.

scenarios.SA: IP specialist reviews data but doesn't connect cases to emerging cluster.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to escalate potential outbreak vs. continue surveillance.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating infection control requirements to clinical staff.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating outbreak response across multiple departments.
scenarios.LEAD: Director managing hospital-wide response to identified outbreak.
scenarios.HF: Surveillance accuracy when monitoring multiple infection types.

scenarios.SA: Paramedic assesses scene but doesn't anticipate secondary hazards.
scenarios.DM: Deciding transport destination when multiple hospitals could be appropriate.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating patient status to receiving hospital during transport.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating with fire, police, and hospital during multi-vehicle accident.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing multiple units during mass casualty incident.
scenarios.HF: Assessment accuracy after multiple consecutive calls.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Rapid Response
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Patient deterioration requiring rapid response team. Multiple disciplines must coordinate assessment, intervention, and potential ICU transfer.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Surgical Emergency
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Emergency surgery required for unstable patient. OR must prepare while patient stabilized, blood products obtained, and safe transport coordinated.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Outbreak Response
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Suspected infectious outbreak identified. Requires isolation protocols, enhanced cleaning, surveillance, and communication across hospital.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Discharge Crunch
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Hospital at capacity with multiple admissions pending. Requires coordinated discharge process to create bed availability.
